meanings.sent1: He is so thickheaded that it takes him a long time to grasp new concepts.
meanings.sent2: She can be a bit thickheaded when it comes to learning new skills.
meanings.sent4: His thickheadedness was like a wall blocking any new ideas from entering his mind.
meanings.sent5: The thickheaded man couldn't even understand the simplest instructions.

meanings.sent1: Despite being wrong, he remained thickheaded and refused to change his opinion.
meanings.sent2: She can be so thickheaded that she won't even consider a different point of view.
meanings.sent3: The thickheaded mule refused to move no matter how much they tried to persuade it.
meanings.sent4: Her thickheaded determination was like a boulder in the path of progress.
meanings.sent5: The thickheaded child insisted on wearing shorts in the snow, refusing to listen to reason.

meanings.definition: Having a thick skull or head.
meanings.sent1: The thickheaded dinosaur had a skull that could withstand powerful impacts.
meanings.sent2: The thickheaded rhinoceros used its strong head for defense against predators.
meanings.sent3: The thickheaded statue seemed invincible to any attempts to break it.
meanings.sent4: His thickheaded helmet protected him from serious injury during the accident.
meanings.sent5: The thickheaded turtle's shell was its best defense against danger.
